description:
At Austrian press conference on August 17th, Education Minister Heinz Faßmann presented the plan for reopening schools. The minister “wants” schools and childcare facilities to resume regular instruction in the fall, but has outlined measures to reduce the spread of the virus.
Schools will be coordinated with the Health Ministry’s “Corona Ampel” (traffic light) that is planned to go live this fall. Some measures:
- Sick children should stay home.
- Windows in classrooms will be opened for at least five minutes every 20 minutes, even once temperatures grow colder during fall and winter.
- Masks must be worn upon entering and exiting school buildings, but are not required inside classrooms.
- Teachers will be provided with FFP2 masks and receive a flu shot.

description:

description:
Since March, Austrian national policy set restrictions and has forbidden visits senior houses, from May 4 this policy is no longer valid (visits from May 4 are available, but under strict conditions to protect the people living there).

Some of the restricions:
-Coordination of visits by the facility, an appointment in advance is required.
-Set limited hours of visit by the facility.
-Limitation of the number of visitors.
-In the first step, the visits to the facilities should only take place individually (one visitor per resident).

The administration of Vienna has issued new regulations (35. Verordnung) for visits in hospitals, nursing and care homes, starting from the the 29.05.2020. Visits are allowed again but only with mandatory masks and one visitor per 10 m2 in the patient rooms. Patients are only allowed to have one visitor per day, two visitors are only allowed in exceptions (such as childbirth, dementia, citical life phases). Visits of a person with potential symptoms of Covid 19 are still prohibited. Visits of children are only allowed in exceptions.

The administration of Lower Austria has issues new regulations for hospital visits since the 01.06.2020. The general regulations for all visitors of patients within hospitals, care homes and other health spaces are the mandatory use of a mask, desinfection of hands, making an appointment beforehand, a minimum 1 meter distance between individuals and a maximum amount of visitors per room. However, individual hospital also have specific additional regulations, which vary in the allowed length of the visit (20 min to 45 min), specific visitation periods and testing when entering the main entrance.

The administration of Salzburg issued new regulations for hospital visits on the 04.06.2020. Since then patients are allowed to have one visit per day by one person. More visitors are only allowed in exceptional situations, such as childbrith or crisis situations. General hygiene regulations are mandatory mask use, one meter distance and disinfecting hands.

In Tyrol, hospital visit regulations have been allowed again since the 04.06.2020 but only under strict regulations. Patients, who have been staying at a hospital for more than a week, are allowed to have only one visitor per day for a maximum of 30 minutes. For people accompanying a patient into the hospital, Corona tests via smear testing are mandatory. Furthermore, individual hospitals have issues some additional regulations for their specific spaces.

Upper Austria (OÖ) has announced new hospital visit regulations according to the 4x1 Rule, starting from the 05.06.2020. Under this rule, a patient is allowed one visitor per day for one hour, most likely during the afternoon. Furthermore, hospitalized children are allowed to be visited by both parents, but not silmultaneously. Ambulance regulations stay the same and require 1,5 m distance betewen patients.
